item.title: Wall Street will be ruled by ‘rumor and pseudo-drama’ if government shutdown goes ahead, warns UBS
item.description: Wall Street braces for a U.S. government shutdown as payroll data stalls, leaving the Fed and investors flying blind on key economic signals.

item.title: Back in the 90s a Fed chief warned about ‘irrational exuberance’ in the markets. Stocks rose 105% over the next 4 years
item.description: Even if Fed chairs see a market that's overvalued, that doesn't mean a crash is near.

item.title: Florida landlords are turning away immigrants on temporary legal status as deportation worries loom
item.description: This could violate fair housing law, experts say.

item.title: Why Lyft CEO David Risher still drives customers once a month
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The job market is so broken that Gen Z men are gambling their paychecks for a shot at instant millions: ‘$256K is about to go down on the table’
item.description: Millions of Gen Z men are jobless. With unemployment stacked against them, many are gambling thousands away on blackjack and roulette, rather than cli...
